001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.distances;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004
005/**
006 * Concrete implementation of the {@link DistanceMetric} strategy that
007 * calculates the <b>Euclidean distance</b> between two points in
008 * n-dimensional space.
009 * <p>
010 * Euclidean distance is defined as the square root of the sum of squared
011 * differences between corresponding coordinates:
012 *
013 * <pre>
014 * d(p, q) = sqrt( (p₁ - q₁)² + (p₂ - q₂)² + ... + (pₙ - qₙ)² )
015 * </pre>
016 */
017@Strategy(role = Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
018public class EuclideanDistance implements DistanceMetric {
019
020    /**
021     * Calculates the Euclidean distance between two points.
022     *
023     * @param point1 first point to compare
024     * @param point2 second point to compare
025     * @return the Euclidean distance between point1 and point2
026     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the points are null or have different dimensions
027     */
028    @Override
029    public float distance(float[] point1, float[] point2) {
030        if (point1 == null || point2 == null) {
031            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Points must not be null.");
032        }
033        if (point1.length != point2.length) {
034            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Points must have the same dimension.");
035        }
036
037        float sum = 0.0f;
038        for (int i = 0; i < point1.length; i++) {
039            float diff = point1[i] - point2[i];
040            sum += diff * diff;
041        }
042
043        return (float) Math.sqrt(sum);
044    }
045}
